item.title: PLACES STILL AVAILABLE – Thursday 9th May – 6:45pm – SwimMark Essential Club Information Workshop ONLINE
item.dc:creator: Daniel Ramm
item.description:
On Thursday 9th May 2019 at 6:45pm there will be a SwimMark Essential Club Information Workshop held online. The workshop is free and open to all clubs.   The aim of the workshop is to provide information to clubs looking start or complete their SwimMark essential accreditation and will cover the following areas:   Overview […]

The post PLACES STILL AVAILABLE – Thursday 9th May – 6:45pm – SwimMark Essential Club Information Workshop ONLINE appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
On Thursday 9th May 2019 at 6:45pm there will be a SwimMark Essential Club Information Workshop held online. The workshop is free and open to all clubs.

 

The aim of the workshop is to provide information to clubs looking start or complete their SwimMark essential accreditation and will cover the following areas:

 

  • Overview of the SwimMark accreditation – accreditation and benefits.
  • Guide to using the SwimMark portal and the accreditation process.
  • Run-through of the evidence required for accreditation.

 

There will also be an opportunity to ask any questions you may have specific to your club or the SwimMark process.

 

If you would be interested in attending or have any questions, please can you email Swim England Club Development Officer, Daniel Ramm on daniel.ramm@swimming.org  with your name and contact email address, so he can reserve you a place and send you joining instructions.

Post expires at 10:18pm on Friday June 7th, 2019

The post PLACES STILL AVAILABLE – Thursday 9th May – 6:45pm – SwimMark Essential Club Information Workshop ONLINE appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: Swim England North East Region Championships 2019 – Sheffield
item.dc:creator: Linda Tjaguns
item.description:
All, The Management of the North East Region Championships would like to thank all the volunteers for their perseverance, disciple and cheerfulness at the recent Open Championships held at Ponds Forge, Sheffield. Your hard work ensured the success of the event for all swimmers, coaches and spectators.   The Championship Management

The post Swim England North East Region Championships 2019 – Sheffield appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
All,

The Management of the North East Region Championships would like to thank all the volunteers for their perseverance, disciple and cheerfulness at the recent Open Championships held at Ponds Forge, Sheffield.

Your hard work ensured the success of the event for all swimmers, coaches and spectators.

 

The Championship Management

item.title: Swim England Coaching & Teaching Register – Stage 2
item.dc:creator: Linda Tjaguns
item.description:
The launch of the Coaching and Teaching Register, in January, led to exceptionally high response levels, with more than 950 clubs providing information about their active coaches and teachers. In order to ensure that we have the most up-to-date information for our coaches and teachers, we are now asking individuals to verify the details that we […]

The post Swim England Coaching & Teaching Register – Stage 2 appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
The launch of the Coaching and Teaching Register, in January, led to exceptionally high response levels, with more than 950 clubs providing information about their active coaches and teachers.

In order to ensure that we have the most up-to-date information for our coaches and teachers, we are now asking individuals to verify the details that we hold (i.e. qualification information, DBS and safeguarding).

To check this information, we are asking coaches and teachers to log into their Online Membership System account between 1 May and the end of July 2019.

Click here

The post Swim England Coaching & Teaching Register – Stage 2 appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: World Para-Swimming Championships Selections 2019
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description:
Swim England North East swimmers are represented in the 24 swimmers who are selected as part of the British Swimming Team that will take part in the World Para-Swimming Championships at London Aquatics Centre from 9th-15th September 2019. Further details are available at: https://www.swimming.org/sport/world-paraswimming-championships-squad/

item.content:encoded:

item.title: The Nations Biggest Sports Day – I Am Team GB
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description:
I Am Team GB is an initiative inspired by Team GB and supported by Toyota to get as many people as possible physically active in their communities. Inspired by the achievements of Team GB athletes and the amazing efforts of local community heroes, I Am Team GB have created The Nation’s Biggest Sports Day, taking […]

The post The Nations Biggest Sports Day – I Am Team GB appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
I Am Team GB is an initiative inspired by Team GB and supported by Toyota to get as many people as possible physically active in their communities.

Inspired by the achievements of Team GB athletes and the amazing efforts of local community heroes, I Am Team GB have created The Nation’s Biggest Sports Day, taking place on Saturday 24 August 2019.

This is an excellent opportunity for:

  • clubs to get more people trying out their sport or physical activity
  • showcasing the amazing contributions volunteers make in their communities
  • targeting marginalised and inactive groups showing them the social value of sport
  • helping foster social cohesion and community development

It’s really easy to sign up as an I Am Team GB Games Maker and put on an activity for your local community. Click here to fill in your details and you’ll get the option to create your activity now or later, if you prefer. You’ll get lots of support to help you put on your activity and receive an official I Am Team GB Games Maker T-Shirt and digital pack.

To find out much more about what’s involved, check out their FAQs.

Post expires at 9:02am on Sunday August 25th, 2019

The post The Nations Biggest Sports Day – I Am Team GB appeared first on Swim England North East.

item.title: Coach Development Workshops
item.dc:creator: David Parry
item.description:
Two Swimming Coach CPD workshops have are scheduled to take place on Saturday 29th June. The workshops will focus on improving nutrition & psychology for your athletes. The nutrition workshop will cover: o  Fuel for the male and female swimmer o   Supplement Safety o   Race day good practice The psychology workshop will cover how to optimise performance […]

The post Coach Development Workshops appeared first on Swim England North East.
item.content:encoded:
Two Swimming Coach CPD workshops have are scheduled to take place on Saturday 29th June. The workshops will focus on improving nutrition & psychology for your athletes.

The nutrition workshop will cover:

o  Fuel for the male and female swimmer

o   Supplement Safety

o   Race day good practice

The psychology workshop will cover how to optimise performance under pressure: An introduction to mental skills and sport psychology to get the most from your athletes.

Both workshops will be delivered by Swim England Sports Science Specialists Andrew Shepherd and Stephen Eccles

Date: Saturday 29th June 2019

Venue: The Louisa Centre, Front St, Stanley DH9 0TE

Time: 10:30am to 3:00pm

Cost: £20 per candidate (includes refreshments and a light lunch).

Places can be booked at: Improving Nutrition & Psychology for your Athletes – Swimming Coach CPD Workshop

Post expires at 1:28pm on Sunday June 30th, 2019

The post Coach Development Workshops appeared first on Swim England North East.
